job description:
Job Description: Scientist, mass spectrometry (MS)

Position description:

Pharmaceutical Cancer Immunology Discovery Unit (CID), located in South San Francisco, is a pioneer in antibody based therapeutics. We currently have a great opportunity for a contractor scientist to join mass spectrometry (MS) group in Biotherapeutic Design and Discovery (BDD) division for an exciting project with 1 year duration.

The selected candidate will perform MS-based antibody de novo sequencing and/or proteomics analysis, as well as antibody intact analytical characterization. To succeed, you will need to be an enthusiastic team player, detail-oriented, extremely organized and comfortable working on complex problems. This is a hands-on bench position, focused on sample preparation, MS data acquisition, instrument maintenance/troubleshooting and data analysis.

Responsibilities:

This candidate should have the ability to independently plan, design, and implement protocols to successfully solve issues related to protein characterization and de novo sequencing. The individual will be responsible for the whole workflow from sample preparation to data analysis.
  • Perform sample preparations including antibody digestions for peptide mapping analysis, and assist the fluorochromes labeling preparation for flow cytometry
  • De novo sequence and analyze intact and subunit of Ab using state of the art MS techniques and software
  • Maintain and troubleshoot Thermo Orbitrap mass spectrometers and nano-LC systems
  • Support the recombinant Ab expressions and purifications with AKTA systems
  • Maintain excellent documentation of all work including laboratory notebooks, test methods, or any other appropriate documents.
  • Write and review internal reports, in addition to presenting results and experimental information to departmental colleagues
Qualifications:
  • PhD in analytical chemistry, biochemistry or related scientific fields or master with 3 years of industrial experience in proteomics and/or monoclonal antibody characterization
  • Hands-on experience in sample preparation including peptide mapping, antibody purification and labeling
  • 2+ years of experience in proteomics and intact protein analysis on Thermo Q Exactive Series and LTQ Orbitrap Velos mass spectrometers equipped with Flex Ion Source is strongly preferred
  • Experience in maintaining and troubleshooting Agilent and Dionex nanoflow UPLC and mass spectrometers
  • Experience with recombinant antibody purification with AKTA system is desired but not required
  • Strong communication skills and exemplary attention to detail
